intro: Eriocephalus klinghardtensis, commonly known as the Kleinmann's eriocephalus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are clustered in a spherical shape, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
